SELECT 
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsestoragee.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT ='csv',
        PARSER_VERSION= '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS[result]


    -- Examine the data types for the columns by using stored procedure for show all datatype and detail of column
    EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set 
    N'SELECT 
        TOP 100 * 
    FROM 
        OPENROWSET (
            BULK ''https://synapsestoragee.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv'',
            FORMAT = ''csv'',
            PARSER_VERSION=''2.0'',
            HEADER_ROW = TRUE
        )AS [result]'

-- See max length of each column

SELECT 
    MAX(LEN(LocationID)) AS len_LocationId,
    MAX(LEN(Borough)) AS len_Borough,
    MAX(LEN(Zone)) AS len_Zone,
    MAX(LEN(service_zone)) AS len_service_zone
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'abfss://nyc-taxi-data@synapsestoragee.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT ='csv',
        PARSER_VERSION= '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) AS[result]

-- Use WITH clause to provide explicit data types

SELECT * 
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsestoragee.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT ='csv',
        PARSER_VERSION= '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )AS[result]

--  See all details of column using stored procedure

  EXEC sp_describe_first_result_set 
    N'
SELECT * 
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ''https://synapsestoragee.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv'',
        FORMAT =''csv'',
        PARSER_VERSION= ''2.0'',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = '','',
        ROWTERMINATOR = ''\n''
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )AS[result]'

-- See default collation
    SELECT name,collation_name FROM sys.databases;

-- specify UTF-8 collation for varchar columns means limitation of columns

SELECT * 
    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsestoragee.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT ='csv',
        PARSER_VERSION= '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
        Zone VARCHAR(50) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8,
        service_zone VARCHAR(15) COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8
    )AS[result]

-- create database and apply collation on it
CREATE DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery;

USE nyc_taxi_discovery

ALTER DATABASE nyc_taxi_discovery COLLATE Latin1_General_100_CI_AI_SC_UTF8;

    FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://synapsestoragee.dfs.core.windows.net/nyc-taxi-data/raw/taxi_zone.csv',
        FORMAT ='csv',
        PARSER_VERSION= '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE,
        FIELDTERMINATOR = ',',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    ) 
    WITH (
        LocationID SMALLINT,
        Borough VARCHAR(15),
        Zone VARCHAR(50),
        service_zone VARCHAR(15)
    )AS[result]
